p.span: Universal Pre-Kindergarten Registration for 2020-21: If your child will be 4 years old on or before December 1, please fill out this form and return it to Stacy Warren at stacy.warren@newarkcsd.org by April 24th. You can also return the form by U.S. mail to the address listed on the form or put it in the mail slot on the corner of the Municipal Building (on the Police Dept side) addressed to the Newark CSD.

Kindergarten Registration for 2020-21: If you have a child who will be 5 on or before December 1st, please complete this Registration Packet and return it either by email to stacy.warren@newarkcsd.org

, U.S. mail it to Newark CSD, Attn: Stacy Warren, 100 East Miller Street or you can put it in the mail slot on the corner of the Municipal Building (on the Police Dept side) addressed in the same manner.

Registrations for 2019-20 School Year: If you have recently moved to Newark and need to register your child for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year, please use the approriate packet below and return it with the necessary documents either by U.S. mail (Newark CSD, Attn: Cathy Jadus, 100 East Miller Street), email it to: catherine.jadus@newarkcsd.org or you can put it in the mail slot on the corner of the Municipal Building (on the Police Dept side) addressed in the same manner above.

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

p.span: Message from Matt Cook, Superintendent of Schools

span.p: Good afternoon Newark CSD families and staff,
I am writing today to let you know that Governor Cuomo has just issued a new Executive Order extending NY Pause and keeping school buildings closed through 5/15/2020.

While we are encouraged by the flattening of the curve in NY City, there remain significant transmission concerns throughout our state and we remain committed to following safety procedures as we continue to make and deliver food through this time period. We will remain on the same Monday, Wednesday schedule for food pick-up and delivery.

As we are all figuring out our new instructional system as we create it, please continue to reach out to me, our building administrators and most importantly the teachers to let us know what is working and what we can improve upon. The feedback is necessary for us to keep refining and improving this new system.
Please stay safe, continue to practice social distancing and hopefully we can get back to school before the 2019-20 school year is over.
Respectfully,
Matt Cook, Superintendent of Schools

a.title: Go to comments for Message from Superintendent Matt Cook

img.title: Newark Central School District is the centerpiece of our community that binds students, staff, families and neighbors through a profound sense of hometown pride. We engage all students with the diverse opportunities and academic experiences they need to reach their maximum potential. Our students thrive in an environment of high expectations, collaboration and respect. Effective communication and sustained connections foster a sense of importance, contributing to the success of every student every day.
img.alt: Newark Central School District is the centerpiece of our community that binds students, staff, families and neighbors through a profound sense of hometown pride. We engage all students with the diverse opportunities and academic experiences they need to reach their maximum potential. Our students thrive in an environment of high expectations, collaboration and respect. Effective communication and sustained connections foster a sense of importance, contributing to the success of every student every day.
